cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles NNW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the Gulf of Mexico, aiming for a Sunday landfall along the central-eastern Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Morgan City to Grand Isle, Louisiana

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cameron, LA to the Mississippi/Alabama border including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Sabine Pass, TX eastward to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.wind: Potential for sustained tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) with a 43% cumulative chance and brief hurricane-force gusts possible if the core passes slightly west of forecast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm Surge Watch in effect; 2–4 ft inundation above ground possible Sabine Pass to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, which includes the Lake Charles access channel.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches possible with locally higher amounts if rain bands wrap into southwest Louisiana, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands, hazardous seas and very rough surf in Calcasieu Pass and offshore approaches.
